business.headline: Diwali 2025: Expert lists best sectors to light up your long-term portfolioOnce seen as a risky bet for the daring few, it's now finding a place right beside traditional investments. From young professionals buying their first mutual fund to families creating demat accounts, the shift is real and growing.

Sensex, Nifty end lower amid profit booking; LG Electronics listing lights up D-StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 297.07 points to close at 82,029.98, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 81.85 points to settle at 25,145.50.

India proving doubters wrong with its economic reforms: IMF chiefSpeaking ahead of the IMF-World Bank annual meetings in Washington, Georgieva said India's strong economic policies and reforms have helped it stand out as one of the world's fastest-growing economies.
Forget stocks, why should you track gold and silver rally this DiwaliWith markets showing uncertainty, should investors consider precious metals over stocks this festive season? Experts explain.
LG Electronics IPO sees bumper listing. Why you shouldn't sell entire stake todayLG Electronics IPO surged over 50% on listing, but should investors sell everything today or hold for bigger gains?

Digital finance isn't foolproof, cautions Zerodha's Nithin KamathFrom Aadhaar e-Sign to mobile apps, digital finance has transformed access to financial services in India. However, Nithin Kamath points out that system failures and delays still pose challenges for users.

Bira 91 went poof! And the name change was just the beer headWhile several news reports said that a change in the name of Indian beer Bira 91 spelt doom for the craft beer brand, it was just the tip of the iceberg. The company is facing a Rs 80-crore loss, supply-chain disruption, and most importantly, internal unrest, with employees demanding the ouster of founder Ankur Jain. This is what industry insiders have to say about the mess at Bira 91.

EPFO now allows 100% PF withdrawal. 7 major changes you should knowMembers of EPFO can now breathe a sigh of relief as the organisation allows full withdrawal of PF balances. Here's a look at seven important changes that will affect how you access your funds.

LG Electronics IPO makes bumper debut. Should you hold or sell?With the stock listing at a sharp premium, booking partial profits allows investors to secure immediate gains, while retaining a portion of shares could help benefit from the company's long-term growth trajectory.
Tata Motors shares crash 40%: Is the Tata stock really down?Tata Motors shares opened at Rs 399 on Tuesday, down around 39.62% from Monday's close of Rs 660.90.

LG Electronics lights up Dalal Street with 50% listing gain on market debutLG Electronics stock market listing: The strong opening reflected robust investor demand and optimism about the company's growth prospects in India's consumer electronics market.
Sensex jumps over 200 points, Nifty above 25,300; HCLTech up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 205.08 points to 82,532.13, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 60.60 points to 25,287.95 as of 9:30 am.

LG Electronics listing today: Investors eye big gains as GMP crosses Rs 400LG Electronics IPO opened for subscription on October 7 and closed on October 9. The price band for the issue was set between Rs 1,080 and Rs 1,140 per share.

Every claim is a fight: Inside a family's months-long health insurance battleIn India, buying health insurance is easy, but claiming it is another battle. Families like Mudit Agarwal's often end up fighting bureaucracy instead of focusing on illness. In this week's story from our ongoing 'Claim Denied' series, we reveal how one family's ordeal exposes the cracks in the system.

LG Electronics share listing today: Will it make bumper debut on stock market?LG Electronics IPO is one of the most talked-about offerings of 2025, attracting bids worth over Rs 4.4 lakh crore against the Rs 11,607 crore issue size.

Vijay Mallya discontinues bankruptcy annulment application in UK ahead of hearingThis means the "Trustee in Bankruptcy" can continue to pursue assets to help a consortium of banks led by the State Bank of India (SBI) realise the repayment of an estimated judgment debt of around 1.05 billion pounds owed by Vijay Mallya's now-defunct Kingfisher Airlines.

Diwali shopping on credit cards? Here's how offers can backfireFestive sales and flashy credit card deals may look irresistible, but hidden charges, interest traps and repayment delays can turn Diwali shopping into a debt headache.

Retail inflation drops to 1.54% in September, lowest in over 8 yearsFood inflation remained negative for the fourth consecutive month, with the Consumer Food Price Index (CFPI) showing a year-on-year decline of 2.28%.

Joel Mokyr, Philippe Aghion, Peter Howitt win Nobel Prize in Economics 2025The Nobel Prize committee said the trio's research has helped economists and policymakers better understand the roots of economic progress.
Sensex, Nifty end in red as IT stocks drag markets; Infosys down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 173.77 points to close at 82,327.05, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 58 points to end at 25,227.35.

entertainment.headline: Ikkis shooting complete: Agastya Nanda 1st look as Lieutenant Arun Kheterpal out Filming for 'Ikkis', which tells the story of Arun Khetarpal, has finally been completed. The film features Agastya Nanda and veteran actor Dharmendra, under the direction of Sriram Raghavan.

The Kerala Story director Sudipto Sen slams Laapataa Ladies' Filmfare awards win Filmmaker Sudipto Sen publicly criticised the Filmfare Awards for awarding films he described as 'plagiarised' and for overlooking notable works. Laapataa Ladies won Best Film and other major honours at the recent ceremony in Ahmedabad, prompting Sen's remarks.

Mirage OTT release: When and where to watch Jeethu Joseph's crime thriller Jeethu Joseph's crime thriller 'Mirage', starring Asif Ali and Aparna Balamurali, is set for its digital premiere on SonyLIV on October 20 after a theatrical release in September. The film, which explores secrets and deception, will be available in seven Indian languages.

Exclusive: Smriti Irani on 8-hour work shifts, gender-based rules in industry Smriti Irani reflected on returning as Tulsi after two decades, sharing candid thoughts on work ethics, motherhood, and the evolving TV industry.

F1 The Movie OTT release: When and where to watch Brad Pitt's film Brad Pitt's 'F1: The Movie' will be available for streaming on Apple TV in December.  Brad Pitt's sports drama has been a blockbuster hit, grossing nearly Rs 5,000 crore and drawing huge crowds even in its re-release.

Aneet Padda turns 23: Saiyaara girl is all smiles as Ahaan Panday feeds cake. Watch Actor Aneet Padda marked her 23rd birthday with rumoured partner Ahaan Panday. The couple remains private despite growing media speculation about their relationship.

Glen Powell's The Running Man trailer out: Die Hard for our time, says Stephen King 'The Running Man' starring Glen Powell has impressed author Stephen King on whose bestselling novel the film is based. The trailer is receiving positive response from fans

Mammootty arrives in London for Patriot shoot, video goes viral Actor Mammootty arrived in London for the next schedule of 'Patriot'. The London leg is set to begin on October 15 and is expected to extend until mid-December.

Bigg Boss Telugu 9: Kitchen clash, nominations and tensions shake up the house The latest episode of 'Bigg Boss Telugu 9' was packed with drama as wildcards started to shake the house dynamics. From heated kitchen arguments to bold personal remarks, emotions ran high, setting the tone for an intense week ahead.

Hansal Mehta backs Lijo Jose Pellissery's love story, AR Rahman onboard for music Filmmaker Hansal Mehta is collaborating with Lijo Jose Pellissery and AR Rahman for a new romantic drama. The film promises a lyrical exploration of love with an original Rahman score, generating high expectations in Indian cinema.

Bison trailer: Dhruv Vikram is an intense kabaddi player dealing with oppression Dhruv Vikram leads 'Bison', a sports drama centred on kabaddi, directed by Mari Selvaraj. The trailer showcases intense scenes set in the 1990s southern Tamil Nadu, with kabaddi central to the story.

Kannada actor Raju Talikote dies of heart attack during film shoot Veteran Kannada actor and director Raju Talikote, 62, suffered a fatal heart attack during a film shoot in Udupi. His last rites will be held in Chikkasindagi village.

Riddick Furya: Vin Diesel back in fourth film of sci-fi series, unveils new look Actor Vin Diesel is back as Riddick in the upcoming sci-fi sequel 'Riddick: Furya'. The film explores the mysterious origins of Furyans and promises intense action and new enemies.

Kalyani Priyadarshan, Dulquer Salmaan react after Lokah's Rs 300-crore global haul 'Lokah Chapter 1: Chandra' crossed Rs 300 crore globally, prompting reactions from the cast. Kalyani Priyadarshan and Dulquer Salmaan shared their gratitude on social media.

Want my DNA in a little person: Jennifer Aniston on infertility and not adopting Jennifer Aniston opened up about her personal experiences with infertility and IVF. The actor addressed speculation on her decision not to adopt children. Aniston shared her feelings about public commentary and personal peace.

Kangana Ranaut on her humble roots and distinct journey from convent-educated SRK Actor Kangana Ranaut highlighted her humble village background in contrast to mainstream stars. She reflected on her journey, challenging the typical Bollywood success story.

Bigg Boss 19: Zeishan Quadri on feeling betrayed by Amaal Mallik post eviction Actor Zeishan Quadri was evicted from Bigg Boss 19 and expressed feelings of betrayal by fellow contestants. His revelations hint at tension and unfair treatment within the show's house dynamics.

Arasan: 5-minute promo locked for Simbu-Vetri Maaran film, to release in theatres A five-minute promo for 'Arasan', starring Silambarasan, has been locked for theatrical and online release. The film's theatrical premiere has been scheduled for October 16.

The curious case of Pradeep Ranganathan: Dude's rise to relevance From short films to the big screen, Pradeep Ranganathan has carved a niche with just two movies, blending youth-centric storytelling, relatable characters, and sharp self-awareness.

general news.headline: Another Haryana cop suicide and bombshell note add twist to IPS officer's suicideAssistant Sub-Inspector Sandeep Kumar, who shot himself dead, made serious allegations against IPS officer Y Puran Kumar, who himself died by suicide on October 7 in Chandigarh.

Doctor arrested over cough syrup deaths admitted to getting commission: PoliceMadhya Pradesh Police informed a district court that arrested doctor Praveen Soni admitted to receiving a 10% commission from the company for prescribing Coldrif cough syrup, which has been linked to multiple child deaths.

Scream and I'll call more men: Bengal gang-rape survivor recalls horrorIn her statement to the doctor, the Durgapur gang-rape survivor described how the men chased, overpowered and assaulted her inside a forest adjacent to her hostel.

BJP releases first Bihar poll list, Speaker Nand Kishore not among 71 names  Live UpdatesWhile the list features both the Deputy Chief Ministers Samrat Choudhary and Vijay Sinha, the party has dropped Assembly Speaker Nand Kishore Yadav from the Patna Sahib seat, which he has represented since 2010.

Meloni and her moments. How Italy PM stole the show at Gaza peace summitEven as top world leaders like Trump gathered for the Gaza peace summit, it was Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni who grabbed the spotlight. Here is how she became the unexpected star of the event.

KBC's viral kid and the six-pocket syndrome: A mirror to modern parentingA KBC contestant's confident interruption has ignited a debate on modern parenting styles in India. Experts link this behaviour to 'Six-Pocket Syndrome,' highlighting the risks of overindulgence and entitlement among children.

Why are Bangladesh's July Movement leaders talking of safe exit?The Muhammad Yunus-led interim setup in Bangladesh is bound by the country's Constitution. There is no provision for a referendum, as is being demanded by fundamentalist and students' parties, in the Constitution. Is that why 'safe exit' is on the lips of July Movement leaders?

MK Stalin will even give free wives for votes: AIADMK leader's shockerAIADMK leader CV Shanmugam sparked controversy by comparing women to election freebies, saying Stalin could even give a "free wife" for votes. DMK condemned the remark, highlighting its women-focused welfare schemes.

Exclusive: Smriti Irani on 8-hour work shifts, gender-based rules in industrySmriti Irani reflected on returning as Tulsi after two decades, sharing candid thoughts on work ethics, motherhood, and the evolving TV industry.

Pakistan first Muslim nation to get Love Island. People sink it in Quran versesPakistani reality dating show, Lazawal Ishq, tried to channel Love Island but ended up delivering a cringe-fest of a series. Pakistanis used Quranic verses to brand it "unIslamic". There's awkward casting, archaic gender dynamics, and an experiment that goes wildly off the rails. But it seemingly shows aspects of Pakistani society that mainstream TV fails to highlight.

Hamas goes on killing spree in Gaza after releasing Israeli hostagesHamas has launched a violent crackdown on rival factions in Gaza, executing eight people by firing squad and clashing with the powerful Doghmush clan, as it seeks to reassert control in the Palestinian territory amid a US-brokered ceasefire. After releasing Israeli hostages, it is turning the gun on its own people.

Bringing industry-leading tech to India: Sundar Pichai briefs PM on mega AI hubAccording to the Google CEO, the mega AI hub project combines gigawatt-scale compute capacity, a new international subsea gateway, and large-scale energy infrastructure.

Who is Premanand Ji Maharaj, whom devotees are offering their kidney?Revered across India, Vrindavan saint Premanand Ji Maharaj is battling complete kidney failure. From celebrities to ordinary devotees, prayers are pouring in for the spiritual guru. Devotees have even come forward to donate their kidney, but the saint has declined the offers, saying he did not wish to cause pain to others.

Shubman Gill's India stamp authority, win first Test series under new captainShubman Gill won his first Test series as captain after India hammered West Indies 2-0 at home. On the final day of the 2nd Test, Gill's India won with 7 wickets in hand.

If I can play Ranji, why can't I play ODIs? Shami's dig at Indian team managementMohammed Shami contradicted chief selector Ajit Agarkar's remarks on his fitness, asserting that if he is fit enough to play four-day Ranji Trophy matches, he is equally capable of handling the demands of 50-over cricket.

Families like Mudit Agarwal's often end up fighting bureaucracy instead of focusing on illness. In this week's story from our ongoing 'Claim Denied' series, we reveal how one family's ordeal exposes the cracks in the system.

Kheliye meeting meeting: Clock ticking, Bihar parties in seat-sharing messLess than a month remains for Bihar elections, but despite several rounds of meetings and to and fro Delhi-Patna flights, both the NDA and the Grand Alliance are yet to sort out the seat-sharing mess.

Why a young KBC contestant's behaviour has put his parents in the firing lineTen-year-old KBC contestant Ishit Bhatt has become the butt of memes and jokes on social media, and the reason is his overconfident demeanour. His parents, too, have been dragged into this, with strangers dissecting their "parenting style" based on a few televised minutes. Is that fair?

Do your magic: Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli get cool message from Shubman GillIndia tour of Australia: Shubman Gill backed Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma to continue their prolific run in one-day internationals as they return to international cricket in a three-match ODI series starting on 19 October. Gill will lead the ODI side for the first time after taking over from Rohit as captain.

Video: Texas girl, 10, saves little brother from choking in heroic momentA 10-year-old girl from Texas saved her younger brother from choking using the Heimlich manoeuvre. Her quick thinking has sparked admiration and led to discussions on the importance of life-saving skills for children.

EPFO now allows 100% PF withdrawal. 7 major changes you should knowMembers of EPFO can now breathe a sigh of relief as the organisation allows full withdrawal of PF balances. Here's a look at seven important changes that will affect how you access your funds.

World forgot how ancient India shaped it, William Dalrymple tells Fareed ZakariaAs historian William Dalrymple puts it, the story of civilisation itself cannot be told without India, a land that once taught the world to think, count, and dream.

sports.headline: Ian Botham slams England's lack of preparation for Ashes 2025: Borderline arrogance Former England all-rounder Ian Botham has raised concerns over England's limited Ashes preparations, highlighting the risks of minimal warm-up matches and fitness management ahead of the Test series in Australia.

Shami vs Agarkar: Pacer Slams 'No Communication' Over Aus Tour Snub This special report focuses on the escalating controversy between senior Indian pacer Mohammed Shami and the BCCI's selection committee, headed by chief selector Ajit Agarkar. Shami is quoted in the bulletin as saying, 'The Indian team did not communicate with me regarding fitness. I am not the one who should inform them about my fitness.' The pacer has publicly questioned his exclusion from the upcoming tour of Australia, stating that if he is fit enough to play four-day Ranji Trophy matches for Bengal, he should be considered for the 50-over format. This comes after Agarkar had reportedly raised concerns about Shami's lack of consistent match practice. Shami refutes any fitness concerns, asserting he is ready to play for the Indian team whenever called upon, creating a standoff between the veteran player and the national selectors.

On Gambhir's birthday, Yuvraj Singh's Arjan Vailly tribute to coach goes viral Yuvraj Singh's witty birthday wish for Gautam Gambhir lit up social media, as the World Cup hero hailed the coach's trademark intensity with a playful Arjan Vailly-themed tribute. Gambhir celebrated his 44th birthday on Tuesday, overseeing India's Test win over the West Indies in New Delhi.

If I can play Ranji, why can't I play ODIs? Shami's dig at Indian team management Mohammed Shami contradicted chief selector Ajit Agarkar's remarks on his fitness, asserting that if he is fit enough to play four-day Ranji Trophy matches, he is equally capable of handling the demands of 50-over cricket.

Do your magic: Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli get cool message from Shubman Gill India tour of Australia: Shubman Gill backed Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma to continue their prolific run in one-day internationals as they return to international cricket in a three-match ODI series starting on 19 October. Gill will lead the ODI side for the first time after taking over from Rohit as captain.

Border Clashes Spill Onto Pitch: Afghanistan To Boycott Pak Tri-Series? The upcoming T20I triangular cricket series between Pakistan, Afghanistan, and Sri Lanka is in jeopardy following intense military conflict between Islamabad and Kabul. According to reports, Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Chairperson Mohsin Naqvi has asked the International Cricket Council to 'start working on an alternate plan as he wants the Tri-Series to go ahead'. The series is scheduled from November 17 to 29. However, with deadly clashes reported along the Durand Line, there are serious doubts over Afghanistan's participation. This development also comes just a week after Afghanistan's Foreign Minister, Amir Khan Muttaqi, concluded a high-profile visit to India. The PCB is reportedly already mulling alternative plans, including a bilateral series with Sri Lanka, to ensure the cricketing window is utilized.

Curious case of Nitish Kumar Reddy: Prized all-rounder goes missing in Delhi Nitish Kumar Reddy was promised to play a starring role in the Delhi Test by the Indian team management, but it became a case of serious underutilization. With the aim to build a pace-bowling all-rounder, India fumbled with Nitish in Delhi.

Captain Gill's Dream Start: India Whitewashes West Indies 2-0 In Test Series. This special report focuses on India's dominant 2-0 Test series victory over the West Indies, marking a momentous first series win for new captain Shubman Gill. 'What an outstanding start Shubham Gill has had to his captaincy career,' says cricket analyst Nikhil, capturing the sentiment of the cricketing world. The series concluded in Delhi with a decisive seven-wicket victory for the hosts, successfully chasing down a target of 121. This whitewash provides a significant boost for a young Indian team under Gill's fresh leadership, especially as they prepare for tougher challenges ahead, including an upcoming white-ball tour of Australia.

Gautam Gambhir told me to think more as proper batter at No.6: Ravindra Jadeja Star India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja said on Tuesday that moving up to number six in the batting order has helped him think 'more as a proper batter,' crediting head coach Gautam Gambhir for a change he believes has brought out the best in him.

Targeting Harshit Rana for YouTube views shameful: Gambhir slams Srikkanth India head coach Gautam Gambhir has ripped into former India cricketer Kris Srikkanth for criticising Harshit Rana's selection in the national team. Gambhir said that it is a little shameful that people are targetting the pacer just to run their YouTube channels.

Watch: Virat Kohli rocks black and white as he arrives in Delhi ahead of Australia tourFormer captain Virat Kohli arrived in New Delhi from London on Tuesday. He, along with Rohit Sharma, will depart with a batch of Indian cricketers for Australia on Wednesday ahead of a three-match ODI series, starting October 19 in Perth.

Gautam Gambhir pragmatic on Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli's 2027 World Cup chancesIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir has broken his silence on the prospects of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma featuring in the 2027 ODI World Cup in South Africa.

IND vs AUS: Josh Inglis, Adam Zampa ruled out series openerIndia vs Australia: Wicketkeeper Josh Inglis and spinner Adam Zampa have been ruled out of Australia's side for their first ODI against India. Inglis has failed to recover from his calf strain in time for the opener.

Brian Lara pens emotional note for West Indies cricket after attending Delhi TestWest Indies legend Brian Lara penned a heartfelt note for the West Indies cricket team after attending the second Test against India at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi.

Day 5: India complete 2-0 series sweep over West IndiesIndia (IND) vs West Indies (WI), 2nd Test Day 5 Highlights: KL Rahul scored a crucial fifty as India secured a seven-wicket victory over the West Indies, completing a 2-0 series whitewash on Day 5 of the second Test in Delhi. This marks India's first Test series win under Shubman Gill's captaincy.

The Ro-Ko return: New leaders Gautam Gambhir and Shubman Gill in hot seatRohit Sharma and Virat Kohli return to international cricket this week, six months after their last outing. The spotlight now falls on Shubman Gill and Gautam Gambhir, who face a crucial test in ensuring a smooth transition on India's path to the 2027 World Cup.

This marks India's first Test series win under Shubman Gill's captaincy.

Nitish Reddy not bowling in Delhi Test? Decision baffles Aakash ChopraIndia vs West Indies: All rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy bowled a grand total of 4 overs in the 2-match Test series vs West Indies. The lack of overs for the player has baffled many, including Aakash Chopra.

Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma should play Vijay Hazare Trophy: Parthiv PatelFormer cricketer Parthiv Patel has urged senior India cricketers Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma to participate in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. Parthiv requests the senior duo to play domestic cricket to maintain cricketing fitness.

Wrestler Aman Sehrawat pleads WFI to reconsider ban on him, admits mistakeParis Olympics bronze medalist grappler Aman Sehrawat on Monday appealed to the Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) to reconsider the one-year ban handed to him for missing weight at the World Championships in Zagreb.

Eager to see Ro-Ko back in Australia, hope Kohli scores 2 hundreds: HarbhajanHarbhajan Singh said that he is excited to see Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli back in action during the Australia tour. Harbhajan also hopes that Kohli will score atleast two hundreds during the tour down under.

Bangladesh captain Nigar Sultana says team left in tears after heartbreaking SA lossBangladesh captain Nigar Sultana said that her team was left in tears after their heartbreaking loss to South Africa in Vizag. Sultana said she was proud of the team's efforts in the close encounter against the Proteas.

Play the spinners effectively: Maddy Green on how New Zealand can beat Sri LankaNew Zealand's Maddy Green believes that the key to beating Sri Lanka in their World Cup league-fixtures is to play their spinners effectively.

We've done well against New Zealand in the past, but that's history: Rumesh RatnayakeSri Lanka head coach, Rumesh Ratnayake, believes that their side may have done well against New Zealand in the recent past, but now it doesn't matter as they face a crucial game in the league stages.

Women's World Cup: Kapp-Tryon fifties help South Africa survive Bangladesh scareWomen's World Cup 2025: Bangladesh's spirited bowling effort and late drama in the field weren't enough as South Africa's experienced duo, Marizanne Kapp and Chloe Tryon, held their nerve to seal a tense three-wicket win in a thriller at the Women's World Cup.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
